    • Constructor Detail

      • WorldMap

        public WorldMap​(int world_tile_size,
                int world_width,
                int world_height)
        Constructor for WorldMap.
        Parameters:
        world_tile_size - The dimensions of each tile (in pixels) tile width = world_tile_size = tile height
        world_width - The number of tiles on each row
        world_height - The number of tiles on each column

    • Method Detail

      • buildWorld

        public void buildWorld()
        Generates a heightmap based on the seed, then samples this heightmap to choose either water, sand or grass tiles.

      • drawTile

        public void drawTile​(int x,
                     int y,
                     com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch)
        Draw the tile located at point P=(x,y).
        Parameters:
        x - The x position of the tile
        y - The y position of the tile
        batch - The SpriteBatch that the tile is to be drawn by
        See Also:
        getTile(int, int)

      • searchMap

        public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 searchMap​(java.util.function.Function<com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2,​java.lang.Boolean> searchCond)
        Searches the map based on the result of a function passed as an argument. Accepts any Function which accepts a Vector2 as input and returns a boolean.
        See GameScreen.setPlayerStartPosition() for an example of its use.
        Parameters:
        searchCond - A function that takes a vector2 as input and returns either true or false based on whether that position is valid
        Returns:
        Returns either a valid Vector2 representing a position that passed the search conditions (i.e searchCond returns true), or null if no such position exists.

      • drawTilesInRange

        public void drawTilesInRange​(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera cam,
                             com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch)
        Draws all tiles in range of the camera.
        Parameters:
        cam - The camera. Contains information about the viewport width and height as well as the position of the camera in the world.
        batch - The SpriteBatch that will draw the tiles.

      • getTile

        public TileType getTile​(int x,
                        int y)
        Get the tile type of the tile positioned at (x,y). If there is no tile defined at this point, it will return TileType.WATER_DEEP.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position of the tile
        y - The y position of the tile
        Returns:
        The tile type at the position, or TileType.WATER_DEEP if there is none

      • getTilesWithinArea

        public java.util.Map<com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2,​TileType> getTilesWithinArea​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle rect,
                                                                                      boolean filterOnlySolid)
        Returns a collection of tiles that are within the bounds of the rectangle
        Parameters:
        rect - the search area
        filterOnlySolid - Filter only the tiles that would cause collision
        Returns:
        The collection of tiles and their types within the area

      • isSolidTileWithinAreaStream

        @Deprecated
public boolean isSolidTileWithinAreaStream​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle rect)
        Deprecated.
        By using streams, it returns whether or not there is at least one solid tile within a given area. Given the nature of streams and filters, the efficiency is poor.
        Parameters:
        rect - the search area
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one solid tile, false otherwise
        See Also:
        isSolidTileWithinArea(Rectangle)

      • isSolidTileWithinArea

        public boolean isSolidTileWithinArea​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle rect)
        Returns whether or not there is at least one solid tile within a given area
        Parameters:
        rect - the search area
        Returns:
        true if there is at least one solid tile, false otherwise
